37947.name: The Top Floor
description: Completely devoid of all natural light, the top level is lit
only by the lanterns which hang along the walls casting eerie
shadows along the floor.  Many citizens of the Keep tell that
it is on this level of the Fort that the secrets of the Keep
are housed.  While not entirely closed to access, one can see
that this level is made to look unwelcoming on purpose.
An office.
An office.
Down the staircase to the main floor.
Made of brass, these small sources of light
beam like pixies, but are not quite enough
to overcome the darkness of the room.

37911.name: {8A Dark Cove{x
description: Water slaps along the rocky shore of the cove gently, as if guided
by a sentient sea.  Tide pools ripple ever so slightly as the smallest
of breezes flows through the semi cavern encircling the protected cove.
From the west comes the strong smell of the ocean.  From the east, an
alluring scent of wood smoke drifts down from the mainland above.
Upwards towards the mainland.

37925.name: Pub Basement
description: Small beams of light trickle down from the floorboards above
creating little light, not nearly enough to see by.  Dust has
collected thick upon the stone brick of the floor beneath.  A
plethora of various junk items are neatly stacked about this
room collecting an equal amount of dust.  On the north end of
the basement there is a massive mirror hung on the wall.
Up the stairs towards light.
Nothing all that interesting here.
Giving a wide reflection of the entire room you see nobody
else here but yourself.

37914.name: {YA W{yide {YD{yirt {YP{yath{x
description: Greenery becomes sparse, as dry dirt dominates the road
in all directions.  Telltale signs such as cart tracks and
hoofprints show proof that traffic increases quite a bit in
comparison to the other trails in the vicinity.  A big sign
has been crudely pounded into the side of this crossroads.
A dirt path.
A heavily travelled road branches off to the north.
A large bluff overlooking the sea.
The gates of a small keep lie beyond.
|             {WThe Lizard Marsh          {y|
| {W<{8---{WStormguard Bluff+Haven's Keep{8---{W> {y|
|                     {Wv                 {y|
|                {WShore Access           {y|

37916.name: Gates of Haven's Keep
description: Torches crackle along the entrance to the small keep,
lighting the path for those travelling both inside and out
of the safety of Haven's Keep.  Though easily defensible,
the gates have remained open for almost as long as anyone
cares to remember.  The keep's banners fly high over the
high walls which have guarded this land for years.
To a crossroads of sorts.
A small door is set into the gates.
These sturdy gates show sure signs of wear as they
have deflected more than a few battles over their
long years of use.  A smaller set of doors is built
into the gates to allow easy passage.
{b-={BH  K{b=-{x
Flying high over the walls, the deep blue banners
flutter lazily in the wind.
In days of old, Haven's Keep served the Sword Coast
as a scouting outpost.  Having the greatest vantage
point in all of the region, they were charged twice
over with both the duty of being a self-sustaining
outpost as well as providing early warning to cities
around them in case of impending invasions.  Darkly
set into the high cliffs, it has housed many famed
warriors despite it's small size.

37917.name: Keep Entrance
description: The flagstones lining the wall are kept to a near shine.
in contrast to the rough stonework outside, it is clear that
the people of the fort are proud indeed and work tirelessly
to keep their home in prime condition.  A small checkpoint
has been erected here to greet newcomers upon arrival.
A small road lead south.
A small road leads northward.
A small door is set into the gates.
A small street leading down the central part
of the keep.
These sturdy gates show sure signs of wear as they
have deflected more than a few battles over their
long years of use.  A smaller set of doors is built
into the gates to allow easy passage.

37919.name: Northwest Road
description: Darkly lit though still visible, the torches have been
set to burn low along this road.  The noise of traffic is
considerably less along this route.  This quadrant seems
dedicated to the residents of Haven's Keep as the guards
lessen and the guard posts give way to housing.
Haven's Keep gates.
The road continues.
This appears to be a housing unit.

37915.name: Stormguard Bluff
description: Wind buffets this tall cliff relentlessly, causing little
flora to grow along it's bank.  Those who brave the heights
are ensured the greatest view of the ocean in the region. In
times past, this bluff was used to provide early warning for
incoming storms as well as the occasional enemy.  Today only
a single sentinel stands serving little more than a ceremonial
service for Haven's Keep.
Towards a large clearing.

37948.name: {8The Tower{x
description: Large windows allow a strong breeze to constantly flow in
the tower. From this tower one can even see the Keep Gates.
However a sharp wit and even sharper memory would remind an
adventurer that from the outside the upper levels appear to
have no windows at all.  Strange symbols {Cpulse{x on the walls
and floor here creating their own light in the event of the
night fall.  Strange artifacts rest forgotten on shelves.
Back out to the stairway.
At first nothing...then a dim glow...then so
{Wbright{x one must turn away.
These house all manner of items, best left
uninspected.
Upon a closer look, small runes are carved into
the sides of these windows giving them their one
way magical properties.
Is that...a human skull?!?

37926.name: Northwest Road
description: Lights burn softly in the windows of the houses that are
inhabiting this sector of the city.  The very air seems to
have changed.  In place of the regimented order that lays
claim to the rest of the Keep, people can be seen talking
freely amongst themselves, having a good time and letting
their hair down after a hard day's work.
The road continues.
An intersection lies ahead.
A large area of {Ggreenery{x can be seen here.

37929.name: Northern Road
description: Central of the residential district it is quite apparent that
a great deal of thought went into the comfort of those that are
living within these walls.  Not the shacks nor smaller houses
that one would expect to find within a Keep of this nature, it
boasts living arrangements which rival a large city.
A homestead lies here.
The road continues.
An intersection lies ahead.

37912.name: {YA S{ymall {YS{yandy {YP{yath{x
description: Dirt and rock gives way to soft yellow sand.  The Sea of Swords
shines as far as the eye can see, sparkling on the vast horizon.
Though a small path, nearly a trail, this walkway appears to be
very well used, as an obvious effort has been made to ensure it's
maintenance.  The sweet smell of burning firewood drifts downwind
from a small, well built keep which sits due north on the cliff
overlooking the sea a great distance below.
The path continues.
Downwards to the water.

37931.name: Trentis' Office
description: This is the office in which the Lord of Haven's Keep
presides.  The paperwork and diplomacy which goes along
with such a task is immense.  As such, the Lord of the
Keep spends most of his glorious time cooped up within
this chamber.  A small window from high along the wall
allows a minute amount of light to trickle in, though
most of the room's illumination shines from a lantern
which sits on top of the large desk central of the room.
The door leads out to the entrance.

37943.name: A Small House
description: This structure is simply made up of one room large enough
to house four people.  Privacy remains the biggest issue to
boot here as there seems little place for one to hide away.
Perhaps this belongs to some of the civilian workers here.
Back out to the road.

37918.name: Haven Main Street
description: Cobblestones had once lined this street, however it
quite apparent that these have been abandoned years ago
in favor of the current packed dirt road which has been
maintained with the same detail and care as the rest of
this keep.  Westward, people who are leaving and coming
migrate.  To the east, activity dies down somewhat.
A mouth-watering smell comes from this direction.
Haven's Keep gates.
The road opens up this direction.

37930.name: Northeast Keep Corner
description: Darnkness envelopes the road once again as the walls to both
the north and south overshadow this portion of the Keep.  The
activity seems to lessen considerably, and even the buildings
themselves even seem to degrade in maintanance along this part
of the road.  Could it be that such a small fortress may have
it's own version of the slums??
The road continues.
A darkened alleyway.

37937.name: Southern Road
description: The sounds of training only become increasingly louder as
the road continues east.  Carts full of supplies move along
the road adding to the deep ruts that are carved into it's
surface.
The road continues.
An interesction lies ahead.
Careful...don't break a leg.
All full of god knows what...

37940.name: {gK{Geep {gG{Gardens{x
description: Constructed in a park-like fashion, this is where the main
supply of vegetable foods for the Keep are cultivated.  Green
appears to be the color of choice here, as even the sky view
is blocked by large trees and hanging plants.  The smell of
fresh grown produce sweetly hangs in the air here.
To the northern road.
To the northwestern road.
Your view is blocked by plantlife.

37927.name: Northwest Keep Corner
description: The nexus which separates the northern and western sides
of the Keep, a dark shadow falls upon this corner as it
is surrounded by walls on both the north and west edges.
The road continues.
The road continues.

37946.name: {RD{ruelin{Rg G{rround{Rs{x
description: Surrounded on all sides by high walls, the dirt of this
small field has harbored more blood than any other area in
Haven's Keep.  Used primarily for training in these modern
times, many of the old timers can remember when this was a
prime area to settle disagreements and old scores.  Once in
a great while some still use it, though generally under the
watchful eye of a mediator these days.
Into the guard's post.

37944.name: Haven's Keep Deli
description: Racks upon racks of various meats hang alongside the wall
here, all fresh, no more than a day old.  It's a tough job
feeding an entire Keep, but the Deli so unoriginally named
has pulled it off for many years now.  A small smokehouse
built into the floorboards allows the meats to cure.
Back to the Main Street.
This is where the meats are prepared.
Pork...lamb...duck...roast, the list goes on.
Smoke seems to be trickling out?!?

37935.name: Southwest Keep Corner
description: Overshadowed by the great walls to the south and west,
light ebbs from this corner but provides a great place to
cool off.  From this vantage point you can see the guards
above, walking the wall's edge on continual watch duty.
The road continues.
The road continues.
They must not be afraid of heights...

37932.name: Fort Antechamber
description: Sparsely decorated, it is clear that somewhere along the
line, someone made an attempt to make this antechamber one
notch above the rest.  Crude tapestries hang from the wall
and stone floors give way to a well worn carpet.  A wooden
stairway of small size, leads downward into Trentis' rooms
which are private from public entrance.
Back to the main entrance.
To the Lord's Chambers.

37913.name: {YA S{ymall {YD{yirt {YP{yath{x
description: The sandy ground below grows course, becoming nothing more
than a fine dirt lining the path.  Faint sounds of civilization
can be heard coming from the keep ahead.  The trail grows only
more well worn as it continues on the northern approach.
A large clearing.
The path continues.

37941.name: Home of Simion
description: A smaller dwelling than many of the others it makes up
for in style, what it lacks in size.  Colorful drapes at
the windows are a hazard to the eyes.  The carpet lining
the floor isn't much better, a tasteful {ypuke {ggreen{x.  One
single bed furnishes the lively room, just big enough as
to allow an adult to squeeze in for the night.
Outside to the road.
{YB{BY{W...{RT{MH{GE{W...{CG{YO{BD{RS{M!{x
Simion's bed.
Yep...still {ypuke {ggreen{x.
Yep...still {ypuke {ggreen{x.

37945.name: Keep Guard's Outpost
description: Built with the sole purpose of housing and preparing a unit
for combat, this has served that purpose since the Keep itself
was built.  A {8dark stone{x floor meets {8stone{x walls and raises up
to meet a {8stone{x ceiling.  Coldness envelopes this room but for
a small forge in the corner which is used to create weapons in
which to arm the troops.  The age of this building can be told
within the large cracks where the wall filling has eroded.
Back outside to the road.
A wooden door.
The {8forge {Rburns {Ybrig{Whtly{x at the ready.

37939.name: Militia Way
description: Should ever Haven's Keep fall under attack, this alleyway
serves as a muster point for the troops before they march to
battle through the southern roads.  Though empty most of the
time, this is usually the first place new recruits come when
learning their first session of drills.
An intersection lies ahead.

37923.name: Graven's Pub
description: Warmth envelopes this room, originating from the fire
which roars on the far side of the pub.  Tables are set
up to provide patrons with a place to sit and swap old
battle tales whilst drinking the daily special.  A bar
on the end of the room opposite the door is staffed by
none other than Graven himself.
Back to the road.
A small stairway leads down into the basement.
The tables here are filled with regulars.
You may want to find a spot at the bar.

37920.name: Southwest Road
description: It is not difficult for most to discern where the
military of the Keep is based out of.  Never do the
lights burn low here.  Never do the guards cease in
entering or exiting their compounds.  Like clockwork
patrolman walk their routes, all while their captains
continue to inspect performance and readiness.
Haven's Keep gates.

37942.name: Haven's Keep Mob Storage
description: This area is not for you to be in.  If you have
somehow stumbled upon it, please consult an immortal
for assistance immediately.

37921.name: Haven Circle
description: Main Street opens into a large circle.  Most of the ancient
cobbles here are still intact, as an extended effort has been
made to preserve them.  The street continuing deeper into the
Keep leads directly to a large fort which has been built east
against the wall, rising slightly over the walls.  A sign has
been placed here for those unfamiliar with the Keep to read.
A placard is placed against the fortess wall here.
A small pub sits here.
A small temple lies here.
The road continues.
A small fort.
{R**WARNING**{x
Entrance beyond this point is restricted
to Keep miltia only.  Enter at you're own
risk.
Temple of Tempus:  {RNorth{x
Fort Haven:  {MEast{x
Graven's Pub: {rSouth{x

37924.name: Fort Haven Foyer
description: Built not for comfort, this is a construction designed for
nothing more than to serve it's purpose as the ruling hub of
Haven's Keep.  Though not an official government of it's own
and clearly not belonging to any particular government, daily
decisions ruling the small outpost are made here.  The thick
stone walls effectively keep out the heat of the sun causing
the temperature in this complex to be perpetually cold.
The door leading outside.
A large staircase leads to the upper levels.

37936.name: Southern Road
description: As opposed to it's northern cousin, the Southern Street is
completely devoid of civilain citizens.  It's no secret that
the business of Haven's Keep is war.  And it is here on this
street that business is made good.  Loud shouts and the crash
of metal upon metal can be heard from a training yard off in
the distance.
A large stone building lies here.
An intersection lies ahead.
The road continues.

37934.name: Southwest Road
description: Regiments march the road in an orderly fashion as they go
about practicing their drills.  Should the need for battle
arise, these soldiers are determined to be prepared.  This
road has been even moreso tightly packed down than the rest
so as to limit the amount of time soldiers spend cleaning it
from their armor.
The road continues.
An intersection lies ahead.

37922.name: Temple Of Tempus
description: Murals of violent battles stretch across the walls of this
chamber, crudely sketched sparing no bloody images from view.
The floor is laden with {rdark blood red{x tiles which reflect a
pale light which shines from an unseen source above.  At the
far end of the room an alter stands proudly displaying highly
the symbol of Tempus in tribute to the god of war.  A metal
plaque hangs on the entrance here for all to view.
Back to the road.
The symbol of Tempus is depicted here as a
{Yblazing {Wsilver{x sword on a {rblood red{x field.
"Though we embrace the battles in which Tempus has
destined us to take part in.  There shall be none
who engage combat within these temple walls."

37928.name: Northern Road
description: For a road so far off the main street, this seems quite
well travelled in it's own right.  Packed tightly, this
road bears the scars of wagon ruts down the center lane.
The housing units continue to provide shelter for people
of the Keep along this route.
A large area of {Ggreenery{x can be seen.
An intersection lies ahead.
The road continues.

37938.name: Southeast Keep Corner
description: The road changes abruptly here from dirt to paved stone to
the north, to provide additional support to the Keep traffic.
The smell of sweat is carried in the air, intermingling with
a faint smell of the sea from just over the cliff.
The road continues.
The road continues.

37933.name: {8A Dark Alley{x
description: Little, if nothing can be made out within this small alley.
The dirt road here is rough and probably hasn't seen the care
which details the rest of the Keep.  A few discarded items at
road's side confirm the theory that this alley remains as one
not used by Keep citizens or military.
Junk...just junk.

37911.name: a beach seagull~
description:
Feasting upon the rich beaches of the Sword Coast has
kept this bird fat and happy.  However one cannot help
but wonder if perhaps the locals have had something to
do with feeding the animals here.
37911.d_flags: D {cfalls to the ground in a flurry of feathers.{x~
37911.room_name: A seagull flies about the cove.

37912.name: a bluff sentinel~
description:
While some would consider this to be a meaningless
task, the people of Haven's Keep regard this as one
of the greatest honors that can be bestowed upon a
member of the guard.  As such this man is clearly on
the verge of retirement given his age.
37912.d_flags: D {cdrops dead, clutching at an item inside his pocket.{x~
37912.room_name: The Sentinel of the Bluff scans the horizon.

37913.name: Praetor~
description:
For most of his long years Praetor has kept
a guarded watch on the gates of his homeland.
Scars web across his gnarled face, proving that
he has had need to defend his post on more than
one occasion.
37913.room_name: The Guard of Gates, Praetor stands vigilant over the Keep.

37914.name: Simion~
description:
Though the guardsman outside keeps enemies at
bay, it is the job of Simion to welcome those
wanderers admitted to the Keep.  A young man
whose family served the Keep for generations,
Simion carries the same sense of duty as his
predecessors.  The shoulder length brown hair
and child like facial features have fooled a
great deal of people into believing he is not
a capable warrior.  Care to try?
37914.d_flags: D {ccollapses to the ground in a heap.{x~
37914.room_name: Simion, the Keep Greeter waves travellers through.

37915.name: Gloria, Priestess of Tempus~
description:
Built perhaps a little too tall for battle, Gloria
chose to dedicate her life to Tempus in other ways
than those most conventional within the clergy.  A
seasoned veteran in the ranks of Tempus' followers
she was assigned to Haven's Keep in an attempt to
find a perfect fit for this raven haired mistress
of battle.
37915.d_flags: D {clooks up to the heavens before falling silently to the ground.{x~
37915.room_name: A tall thin Priestess of Tempus presides here.

37916.name: Graven~
description:
Though his hairline has receded since opening his
pub, his service has not.  Slim and standing the
great height of nearly seven feet, he is not one
to be lost in a crowd.
37916.d_flags: D {cgags on his own blood.  {M'{mThis never happens in MY pub!{M'{x~
37916.room_name: The owner of the pub, Graven serves up drinks.

37917.name: Zhelbol~
description:
This man who stands before you, bears a remarkable
resemblance to the pub owner above.  As pale white
as the moon, and catlike in his movements he looks
out upon the world from his strange red eyes with
a hunger that would discomfort even the most brave
of citizens.
37917.d_flags: D {cgrimaces as his eyes darken to black before he falls.{x~
37917.room_name: A thin pale man narrows his eyes as you enter.

37918.name: a sentry of the fort~
description:
Trained for months on end, defenders of Haven's
Keep graduate to this position usually after a
candidate serves more than a few years of patrol
duty.  Toned and ready for combat, this sentry
means business!
37918.d_flags: D {clashes out once more before tumbling into the road...dead.{x~
37918.room_name: A sentry charged with guarding the fort remains alert.

37919.name: a young child~
description:
Children such as these belong to the inhabitants
who work here in the keep.  Within this sector of
the Keep they may play and even train to someday
perhaps serve within the keep themselves.
37919.room_name: A happy looking child plays in the road.

37920.name: an angry father~
description:
Someone has pissed this guy off big time!
One can't help to wonder what has driven
this poor man to the state he is now in.
37920.room_name: An angry father seeths, clenching his fists.

37921.name: Landon~
description:
The locals tell that this man originally came
from Baldur's Gate.  Why he is here now is up
to now a complete mystery.  Why the leaders of
the Keep have allowed him to stay is a larger
mystery yet.  The foolish grin his face wears
leads one to believe that his days are wasted
drinking within this alley.  The hard glint in
his eyes however, can't help but make on think
that perhaps something else is afoot.
37921.d_flags: D {cshrugs {M'{mWell...there's a first time for everything.{M'{x~
37921.room_name: A drunk staggers amongst the shadows.

37922.name: a member of the watch~
description:
Usually the first tour of duty given to newer
recruits, Keep Watch is nonetheless a vital
role here.  They are usually the first to enter
combat, and the last ones to leave it.
37922.room_name: A Keep Watch member patrols the road.

37923.name: Simion~
description:
Though the guardsman outside keeps enemies at
bay, it is the job of Simion to welcome those
wanderers admitted to the Keep.  A young man
whose family served the Keep for generations,
Simion carries the same sense of duty as his
predecessors.  The shoulder length brown hair
and child like facial features have fooled a
great deal of people into believing he is not
a capable warrior.  Care to try?
37923.d_flags: D {ccollapses to the ground in a heap.{x~
37923.room_name: An exhausted looking Simion is here.

37924.name: Crystal~
description:
An earthy woman of short stature and dirty brown
hair, Crystal has tended to the Keep for the past
ten years or so.  Little about her origins is made
public.  Perhaps in her mid-fourties Crystal has
made it her personal quest to keep the small child
down the road out of her garden.
37924.d_flags: D {cfalls to the ground, her skin turning {ybrown{c as the earth.{x~
37924.room_name: The Gardener of the Keep tends the plants.

37925.name: Keaton~
description:
Keaton is a man at one with the ways of combat.
Originally a priest of Tempus, he left the church
at an early point in his career to deal direct
homage in the fields of battle.  A man of about
fourty years of age, Keaton keeps no hair atop
his head.  A large scar runs the course of his
bald pate, ending at the bridge of his nose.
37925.d_flags: D {csinks to one knee whispering, {M'{mIt cannot be...{M'{x~
37925.room_name: A combat instructor paces the road impatiently.

37926.name: a keep guard~
description:
Graduates who perform well as members of the
Keep Watch, will eventually be allowed to try
out for the Keep Guard, which serves as elite
warriors to be trusted to personally ensure a
safe and well trained militia unit.
subroutines:
M death 37925 5~
M greet 37926 100~
M entry 37926 75~
37926.room_name: A guard of the Keep is preparing for patrol here.

37927.name: Gristle~
description:
Despite that one 'goblin burger' incident over
a year ago, Gristle usually puts out some very
good dishes.  People have been known to travel
great distances (over the next hill) to be the
first to try his latest and greatest.  Gristle
stands an almighty 5'3" tall and from the round
bulge in his midsection appears to enjoy trying
out his own dishes on a regular basis himself.
37927.d_flags: D {cwonders why you would kill a simple butcher.{x~
37927.room_name: Gristle, the butcher hacks at a chunk of meat.

37928.name: Lord Trentis~
description:
A regal and wizened man of large stature, the
Lord of Haven's Keep earned his place by vote
of the support council.  Having worked his way
through the ranks of the guard, he is regarded
as one of the most legendary of diplomats and
politicians along the Sword Coast.  Though at
times offered larger appointments elsewhere he
has turned each down in favor of his homeland.
37928.d_flags: D {cholds up his arm in protection, the drops dead.{x~
37928.room_name: An imposing man with long robes stands here.

37929.name: the Highmage~
description:
Aside from his black flowing robes, it is difficult
to discern much else about the mysterious mage who
heads up the magical defenses for Haven's Keep.  A
rumor floats about the Keep that he originally came
from lands far to the west known as the Great Realms.
but aside from that not even his name is known.
37929.d_flags: D {cmutters a curse as his eyes go blank.{x~
37929.room_name: A man obscured by dark robes gazes out the window.

37930.name: Bartlett~
description:
Bartlett came from the eastern forests after his
woodland home was destroyed by invading armies.
Now he helps seek out those who would invade his
home with the help of civilization.  A short and
well built man, his red hair and beard reflect a
fiery determination and iron will.
37930.room_name: The Commander of the Bluff goes over his reports here.

37931.name: the quartermaster of the Keep~
description:
Not one to fight the battles, this soldier has
taken the cause to preparing his comrades for
the rigors of battle.  Though one might think
it not the most glorious of positions, it still
remains one of the most important.  The lack of
combat clearly shows on this man, as his belly
is the largest part of his body.
37931.room_name: The Keep's quartermaster checklists his stores.

37932.name: Penny, the puppy~
description:
Perhaps belonging to one of the families
living within the Keep, Penny walks about
the roads looking for affection.
37932.d_flags: D {cyelps in pain, then lies still.{x~
37932.room_name: A small puppy roams the roads.

37949.name: {*Terah{x~
37949.room_name: {*The exquisite statue of a serene and lovely female human takes your breath away...{x
